bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES W. NORDSTROM FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELIEF THEREON.
div1.p: That the Court erred in declining and refusing to issue the Writ of Habeas corpus upon the record of the above named cause.
That the Court erred in declining and refusing to show cause why the Writ should not issue in the above named cause.
That the Court erred in refusing to make an order restraining proceedings pending the hearing of the Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus in the above named cause.
div1.ab:
J Hamilton Lewis
J Henry Hemming
Counsel for Petitioner.
div1.p: In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHARLES W.NORDSTROM FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELIEF THEREON.
div1.ab: Jas. Hamilton Lewis and J. Henry Denning
div1.p: Copy of within received and due service of the same acknowledged this day of 1896.
FILED April 20 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT.
